alert.note: Alert for Chaves; De Baca; Roosevelt (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 29 at 8:27PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central and southeast New Mexico, including the following counties, in east central New Mexico, De Baca and Roosevelt. In southeast New Mexico, Chaves. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 822 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated a large area of heavy rain due to thunderstorms drifting south along the Pecos River watershed. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen over parts of the area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - This includes the following highways... Highway 285 between Mile Markers 135 and 153, State Road 20, Dona Anna Road, Cottonwood Road, Mora Road, Sierra Road, Roosevelt Road, Urton Lake Road, Olive Road, and Lovington Road. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
